ISpotLight

Defines a spot light

Module

import Rendering.Caustic.ISpotLight;

Functions
SetAngles
virtual void SetAngles(
float2 
angles
) = 0

Sets the inner (angles.x) and outer (angles.y) angles for the spotlight.  The inner angle defines the area around the direction vector where the light is full intensity. The light intensity then falls off from the inner angle to the outer angle. Areas outside the outer angle are not effected by the light.

Parameters
angles
float2

inner and out angles

GetAngles
virtual float2 GetAngles() = 0

Gets the inner (angles.x) and outer (angles.y) angles for the spotlight.  The inner angle defines the area around the direction vector where the light is full intensity. The light intensity then falls off from the inner angle to the outer angle. Areas outside the outer angle are not effected by the light.

Returns

Returns the inner and out angles

Vector3& 
pos,
Vector3 
&
dir,
FRGBColor& 
color,
float 
intensity
 = 
1000.0f,
float 
innerAngle
 = 
30.0f,
float 
outerAngle
 = 
45.0f,
bool 
castsShadows
 = 
true,
bool 
castsLight
 = 
true
)

Creates a spot light

Parameters
pos
Vector3&

position in world coordinates for the light

dir
Vector3&

direction vector

clr

color of light

intensity
float

intensity of light

innerAngle
float

inner angle defining where light is full intensity

outerAngle
float

outer angle. Light falls off from full to no intensity between inner and outer angle

castsShadows
bool

does this light participate in shadow mapping?

castsLight
bool

does this light illuminate the scene?

Module

import Rendering.Caustic.ISpotLight;
